One again, the notion that ALL gnostic sects saw the world as evil is debatable - however, all of them certainly saw it as inferior to the spiritual reality it followed.
The demiurge is not universally seen as evil by all gnostic sects. Valentinians held him as imperfect and as an embodiment of error, rather than 'evil' per se.
